page.title: 03Guisborough Rd. W.Gt.Ayton
page.content: Guisborough Road is the main A173 road running through Gt.Ayton from Stokesley to Guisborough, so it carries a lot of traffic (about 400 vehicles an hour in day time), mostly cars but some buses and lorries. The part-time Police Station is here as is the Victorian Christ Church, the church hall and the village cemetry. Here also is Yatton House, a day centre for handicapped adults partially ran and funded by charity and partly by the social services. Housing along the road begins as 19th century terracing at the Stone Bridge, the early 20th. century semi-detached. To the east is the 'Linden' area which is partly privately owned and partly council estate, the houses of which are now being bought by the tenants. To the west are allotments and the executive-type Skottowe estate.
